THE THING BURSTS UP BEHIND PIERCE
SUDDENLY, SOMETHING SLICK AND BLACK BREAKS THE
A FLURRY OF BUBBLES FLARES UP IN FRONT OF
THE GAPING BLACK MAW OF 1138 BREAKS THE SURFACE OF
JUMPS OUT OF THE WATER AT HIS FEET, HISSING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light blue sky fills the screen. The CAMERA PANS lower revealing some thin clouds. Finally the CAMERA SPLASHES below the surface of the water and continues to descend. Hundreds of bubbles rise past as the camera swims lazily through azure seas sparkling with sunlight and teeming with brightly colored tropical fish. The bubbles swirl past as we dive down, the water turning paler, the fish becoming duller and more scarce. A large shark swims past us, on the prowl. Deeper and deeper we dive. Soon the water is black as night. Only the faintest slivers of light penetrate down here, and then quickly flicker and die. Large shadowy creatures of the ultra-deep haunt the edges of our vision. Strange luminescent fish with long pointy teeth dart past. The sea bottom draws near, a flat plain scarred by an enormous impact crater, miles in diameter. WE glide over the outer wall, the crater floor looms beneath us. On the bottom, a faint light glimmers. It is an undersea station, a series of five cylinders linked by a central hub. It looks like a giant starfish resting quietly on the ocean floor. Several hundred yards beyond the station, the faint lights of the bio-lab can be seen. This is where all the genetics research is done.

dialogues.speaker: PURPOSE
dialogues.text: There are bold markings on the side of the docking bay:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast. Nine people are seated in the galley. Nobody is talking, only the sound of CLANKING dishware. . DR. ABERNATHY glances across at DR. JERKINS. Jerkins is late fourties, high strung. His eyes are a little red and a little swollen. He has the appearance of someone who is not sleeping well at night. Abernathy takes out a small harmonica from his breast pocket. Jerkins freezes in mid-bite at the sight of the harmonica. Abernathy takes his hankerchief, polishing the harmonica. He taps it in his palm, breaking the reeds free. Abernathy puts the harmonica to his lips and and is about to blow... Jerkins starts to say something...

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: .... when Abernathy slips the harmonica back into his pocket. In some way, he‘has been teasing Jerkins. DIANE NORRIS M.D. has seen-this. She doesn’t find it at all amusing. DREW PIERCE takes a seat at the other end of the table with three of his fellow "support group", JAMES RICHARDSON (Diver), TONY SNYDER (Communications), and JOYCE COLLINS (Diver). There is already a plate of food at his place.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Good morning, campers. (looking down at his plate) . I thought we were out of oatmeal.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: That’s eggs... Pierce gingerly shoves them around on his plate, then looks up at Richardson, who is reading a fax letter written in a childish scrawl.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: What have you got there, Ace?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Letter from Julie.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Check it out... Collins holds up a fax of a picture drawn in crayon -- it’s a stick figure man in a dive suit adjacent to a house under the water. All around are brightly colored trees, flowers and fish. The caption at the top reads: MY DADDY AT WORK Pierce leans over to get a-look.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s pretty good...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Well, it ain’t Rembrandt, pal...but to me it’s priceless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn’t that sweet?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: I told her it was beautiful down here. With flowers and trees... Snyder starts laughing, his mouth gorged with food.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Whata buncha shit...

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Must be nice to have a family waiting for you... This is a conversation they’ve had a thousand times, only this time Pierce gives Collins a strange look.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: After six months, it’s the only thing that keeps me going.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: I could go another six months...as long as they keep laying on that "extra-duty pay".

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Come on, admit it, Pierce. Wouldn’t - you like to have a rug-rat of your own waiting for you when you go topside? But Pierce is busy looking at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Better get the eggheads to work. (standing up, calling to the other end of the table) Let’s go! The bus for the fish factory leaves in five minutes! Valdez, Craven, Abernathy, and Jerkins get up, shuffling towards the hatch. Collins and Richardson also rise. Snyder grabs Richardson’s arm as he starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost whispering) Did ya get them?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got ’em. You gonna fax my letter to Julie this morning?

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: You bet. First thing. Richardson glances around the galley to make sure no one is watching, then digs into his pocket. He palms Snyder a small bottle of pills.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: If Norris finds out where you got these, you’re dead meat, pal.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: She won’t...thanks, man. I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (somewhat disgusted) Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Hey, I just use them to help me to sleep, you know? Christ, what do you think I am? A fucking junkie? He gives Snyder a scrutinzing stare, then exits the galley. As soon as he is gone, Snyder opens the bottle and pops two of the pills.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: (continuing - to himself) Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pierce leads the others into the DSRV, he Pierce starts to sing.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Hi-ho, hi-ho! It’s off to work we go! Come on, eggheads...sing along!

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: The scientists start to sing, half-heartedly along with Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE/OTHERS
dialogues.text: Hi-ho, hi-ho! It’s off to work we go! (some funny verse in here) The scientists start to file into the minisub. Laidlaw stands by the airlock, shrugging into his "woolies" -- insulated coveralls. Norris walks up behind hin.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Can I have a word with you, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Can it wait until I get back from the lab?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: It’1ll only take a minute. Laidlaw sighs, nodding his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norris enters the medical bay followed by Laidlaw, she closes the hatch after he is in.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Have you made a decision about rotation yet? Laidlaw leans against the bulkhead, sipping his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: No. Valdez says they’re on the verge of a major breakthrough. He just needs a few more days...

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Valdez has been saying that for weeks now. He’s part of the problem...he’s pushing too hard. (then) I think we should rotate the whole science team out.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: What’s another week?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: To a veteran like you...nothing. But these men aren’t Navy, they’re scientists. They’ve been trapped ina can at the bottom of the ocean for more than six months now. They need a break. (beat) I don’t want to go over your head on this...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Look, Doctor...it’s your call...

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: I’m telling you...I’m worried about them. Laidlaw takes a moment to think.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Tell you what...why don’t we review these requests on a case by case basis?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Fine. Here’s a list...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (reading over the list) Why do you want to transfer Collins?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (simply) She’s pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Does he know?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Of course she knows, she asked me to run the...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I said, does he know. Does Pierce know?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (surprised) Why not? ° NORRIS I don’t know. He’s not my friend. Laidlaw is cut off by the videocom BUZZER. He crosses to the panel and punches the XMIT switch.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (into videocom) Laidlaw... Pierce’s face blinks on the tiny monitor.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (filtered) We’re ready to pull out, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I’m on my way. (to Norris) Let’s talk about this when I get back.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: I’1l be here. CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw enters the hatch to the DSRV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw crawls into the mini-sub. It’s very cramped. Pierce is in the pilot’s seat in the conning tower, donning a headset. He starts flipping switches, humming quietly to himself. Collins sits directly beneath Pierce, surrounded by video monitors, sonar equipment, recorders, etc. To her left is the cluster of forward viewing ports. They are covered to protect them from scratching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the passenger section in back, Drs. Valdez, Craven, Abernathy, and Jerkins are already strapped in. Laidlaw takes his seat next to Collins, activating his monitors. Three screens labeled: PORT FORWARD STARBD flicker to life. Pierce calls down to Richardson.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Close us up. Richardson closes the hatch, sealing them in. Pierce works more controls, we hear a loud WHIRR, then a metallic THUD. The DSRV start to sway back and forth as it drifts free of the Deepstar. Pierce breaks from his humming into a song.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: «++SO we sailed on to the sun, ‘til we found a sea of green...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Oh, God please. Not again.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (starts to sing MUCH louder) - -+-and we lived beneath the waves in a yellow SUBMARINE! In back, we can HEAR Abernathy join in on harmonica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pierce SINGS and Abernathy PLAYS, the minisub sails across the vast crater to the dim lights of the not-too-distant BIO-LAB. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A DISPLAY SCREEN -- The Advanced Seafloor Profile Sonar -- ASIPS -- a grid of green lines that outline the contour of the seafloor, slowly marching towards us, like an animated 3-D geodetic survey map.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Contact in five-hundred meters and closing. Laidlaw concentrates on the constantly shifting sonar display.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Two hundred meters. Pierce backs off on the throttle, the engine WHINING down as he hits the navigation lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two powerful work lights blaze to life on the minisub, their beams scattered by suspended particles in the water. Ahead, the shadowy form of the Bio-Lab looms up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ASIPS, the computer graphic image of the Bio-Lab nearly fills the screen. An animated overlay gives docking instructions to Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (continuing) Fifty meters...forty... Pierce keeps one eye out the viewport and one eye on his instruments as he carefully maneuvers the minisub alongside the station.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (continuing) ..-thirty...twenty...ten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minisub slips slowly into place next to the docking ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DSRV mates to the docking ring with a reverberating CLANG. Laidlaw presses the AIRLOCK PURGE switch and we HEAR the ROAR of compressed air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compressed air purges the airlock free of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody leaves the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valdez and Craven turn on monitoring equipment while Collins hits the lights. Through the glass wall of the control room, the bio-lab lights flicker on, revealing the vast experimental laboratory. Abernathy and Jerkins, zipping up their sterile suits, step into the "HOT BOX".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Hot Box" is the long narrow corridor for disinfecting persons entering or leaving the bio lab. At either end there are two small pressure doors, set high off the deck. Abernathy and Jerkins move silently through the "Hot Box". Neither speaks or looks at the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw and Valdez watch through the control room window as Abernathy and Jerkins go to work, setting up the day’s experiments.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: How close are you, John?

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Any day now we should have a breakthrough.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Norris is putting a lot of pressure on me to rotate your team out.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: You can’t let her do that, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: She’s threatening to go over my head.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: All I need is a few more days.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I can’t run interference for you much longer. Let’s go, Pierce. Pierce and Laidlaw head for the docking bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and Laidlaw are crossing the docking bay, headed back for the minisub.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t like butting into other people’s problems...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Uh, oh. Is this a Captain/Sailor or Father/Son talk?

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: More like nosey fuck to dickhead. Pierce "ahhhs" in recognition.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (continuing) It seems to me that you had something nice going with Collins and then you just let it die. Collins is great gal and she’s crazy about you, so I ask myself "why is Pierce acting like an asshole?" Pierce scowls.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: It didn’t work out...so what? Happens everyday.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Don’t you think you owe her an explaination?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: What’s there to explain?

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Drew, I was there when you got married, I was there when she died, I was there when you put her in the ground. I know how much you loved her, but you can’t let Kathy’s death hold up the rest of your life. You’ve got to get on with...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Okay, you’ve spoken your piece. Thank you very much. Pierce starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Want some advice?

dialogues.speaker: . PIERCE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Tough, here it comes anyway...give the thing with Collins another chance.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Is that an order?

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: No, it’s just advice...good advice. Just then, Craven enters the docking bay from the control room.

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: Captain, you better come quick...it’s Jerkins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craven, Laidlaw, and Pierce re-enter the control room. Valdez and Collins watch Jerkins storm around the bio-lab through the window.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Okay John, what’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: It’s Jerkins...he’s trapped Dr. Abernathy in the dive well and locked us out of the lab. He says he won’t come out until he gets to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (to Collins) Can you get into the lab?

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: . He’s pressurized the hatch. We can cut through it, but it’1ll take time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to hin. Laidlaw presses the intercom button.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Robby. This is Captain Laidlaw.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: Captain! I want to go home right now! If you don’t send me home right now I’m going to flood the airlock and kill that noisy fat bastard!

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Just settle down, Robby. Dr. Norris has already told me you want to go home and I’ve been working on that.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: Norris said I could go home a month ago!

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I know, Rob. I know. And we are going to send you home...

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: (into intercom) All I’m asking for is a few more days...

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: I want to go RIGHT NOW!!! I’m sick of this place! I’m sick of these stupid experiments! And I’m sick and fucking tired of Abernathy and THAT STUPID

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Okay, Rob! Okay! (to Valdez) John, just butt out a second...Collins, patch me into the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: NO! Nobody talks to him! Not until he promises not to play that....thing!

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I just want to make sure he’s okay, Rob. Let me do that, okay...just let me make sure he’s okay. (to Collins) Tie in the airlock. Collins flips some switches.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: As the airlock camera flickers to life. Abernathy leans against the airlock wall.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Eddie, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ABERNATHY
dialogues.text: Nothing a good meal and a loose woman wouldn’t cure.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Hang on. We're going to get you out of there as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: Not until he gets rid of that STUPID FUCKING HARMONICA!!! For six fucking months that’s all I hear! Mary hada little lamb, little lamb, little lamb! Jesus Christ, LEARN A NEW FUCKING

dialogues.speaker: ABERNATHY
dialogues.text: (Mock serious) It helps me relax. Laidlaw rolls his eyes. He fights to control his temper in dealing with these "men of science".

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Dr. Abernathy, I want you to promise not to play your harmonica in front of Dr. Jerkins, okay?

dialogues.speaker: . ABERNATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. I just thought he was'a music lover.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Now Dr. Jerkins, how about letting Dr. Abernathy out of the airlock. He’s promised not to bother you with his harmonica anymore. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: I want to go home. How many times do I have to tell you?

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I told you...we’re working on it. Abernathy rakes his lips across the harmonica, SCREECHING up and down the scales several times in quick successsion.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: (filtered) GODDAMMIT! There he goes again!! I’m going to KILL that SON OF A BITCH!!!

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 17 Abernathy snickers. He knows this makes Jerkins nuts and delights in it like a schoolboy.

dialogues.speaker: ABERNATHY
dialogues.text: Sorry. I had to relieve some stress.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: Stress! I’11 show you stress, you fat fuck! Jerkins flips the FLOOD switch "on" and "off" quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several gallons of frigid seawater splash down on Abernathy. He screams.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: How do you like that stress, asshole?!!

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Jerkins!

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: I want to go home! Valdez reaches over and presses the MUTE button on the intercom. He turns to Laidlaw.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Captain, we have to get him out of there before he does something stupid. If he harms those specimens, we could lose weeks of hard work.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do, John? All I can do is try to talk him into coming out.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Let me talk to him. Laidlaw thinks about this for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Through the window, Jerkins has been shouting and waving his arms. Suddenly, he throws something at the window where it bounces off with a loud BONK.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (to Valdez) Okay...you try. Valdez switches the speaker back on.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: .--istening to me?!!

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Yes, Jerkins...we’re still listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valdez tries to reason with Jerkins, his voice BOOMING over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: derkins, nobody has asked you to compromise anything here. You’re part of the scientific elite and we’re on the verge of a new age. -

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: What a bunch of bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: The life we are creating now will help mankind tame the underwater frontier. Just like our forefathers used the ox and the dog...

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: What? Like this thing? Jerkins plunges his hand deep into one of the smaller specimen tanks, pulling out a small, disqusting-looki sea creature. The t! ig SCREECHES iondiy, thrashing about_in Jerkins’ hand.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the fuck is this thing? Is ita dog? Noooo! Is it an ox? Noooo! What is it?!! No one knows! We/re just building these things for the hell of it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerkins shakes the sea creature at the monitor, it SCREECHES again as his grip tightens.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: (continuing) And what about 1138?!! What good is that thing to anyone? He gestures to a large cryogenic chamber, frozen vapor trailing off its side. A large red sign on the door reads:

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: 1138 was a mistake, I admit that. But...

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: They’re ALL mistakes!

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Mistakes are important steps in the scientific process...

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: No!! We don’t know what we’re doing!!! Can’t you see that?!! ARE YOU BLIND?!! Just at that moment, Dr. Abernathy starts up with a chorus of "Mary had a little lamb." Jerkins goes beserk.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS
dialogues.text: (screaming into the airlock)

dialogues.speaker: GODDAMNIT
dialogues.text: And with that, Jerkins heaves the SQUEALING sea creature in the direction of the airlock. It hits the control panel, where it crashes against the PURGE button with a loud SPLAT! SURGE Sutton with a ioud SPLAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of gallons of water rush into the dive well, instantly immersing Dr. Abernathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw, Collins, and Pierce watch helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abernathy struggles, drowning in the swirling frigid water. With a deafening WOOSH of compressed air, the dive well purges. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airlock door opens, flushing Dr. Abernathy to the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valdez’ jaw drops to the floor. Craven gasps and makes the sign of the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerkins stares at the airlock control panel with a blank expression. His mind can’t comprehend what has just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw is the first to get over the shock. He turns to Collins and Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Okay, get him out of there. cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins and Pierce carry in heavy welding equipment from the docking bay.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Collins drops down by the sealed hatch next to the bio lab and fires up the cutting nozzle, tuning it to a bright blue flame. She flips down her welding mask and starts to cut the hatch. CAMERA FOLLOWS Pierce as she heads back down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pierce enters, Valdez, Craven, and Laidlaw watch Jerkins in the bio-lab through the window.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Is she cutting through the hatch?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, figure about five minutes. Through the window, Jerkins is strangely silent. He shuffles around the room aimlessly. In his arms he cradles another of the bio- engineered creatures, S$ ing it gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins cutting through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw punches the intercom button.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (into videocom) Collins, are you through that hatch yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins shouts at the videocom, not bothering to look up from her work.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Negative. Two more minutes.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (into videocom) Step on it. : (to Craven) Do we have something to knock him out when she cuts through?

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: (nodding) sodium Pentathol.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Get it ready. Laidlaw then turns to Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (continuing) Get a couple of shotguns out of the sub.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: You’ve got to be kidding...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Just do it! Pierce exits, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HISSS!}!! -- Jerkins spins to see sparks cascading from the hatch where Collins is cutting through. A trapped, haunted expression creeps over his face. He crosses the lab to the cryogenic chamber marked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins cuts through the last few inches of hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Craven draws several cc’s of Sodium Pentathol into a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy metal hatch falls through, hitting the deck with a loud CLANG! Jerkins twists the large, red handle to "OPEN". Foul-smelling green water spews out from around the sides of the chamber door.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Nooooo00! As he screans in frustration and terror we: CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce is jogging back to control room with two shotguns when suddenly, the lights go out. Pierce stumbles in the dark, CRASHING to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch... Then the harsh red emergency light flicker on. Pierce gets to his feet, moving to the control roon door. He tries to open it. Nothing. Pierce opens the door’s emergency access panel and pulls down on a handle. There is a HISS of compressed air escaping, but the door doesn’t move. Crouching down next to the hatch, Pierce gets a handhold on the hatch and strains to lift it. The door slowly GRINDS open, but it’s clear it won’t stay that way on its own. Pierce peers through the ever widening slit in the door, while on the other side...

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 24 ...Dr. Valdez and Laidlaw peer back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw and Valdez are pulling up on the hatch, Dr. Craven stands behind then. As soon as the hatch is high enough, Pierce props it open with his shotgun and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Jerkins opened 1138...I heard him scream...and then the lights went out. Then the door closed and sealed.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: They do that automatically when the power dies. (then) Where’s Collins?

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: She was in the bio-lab...with Jerkins. Pierce dashes for the hatch to the "Hot Box". He pulls down the manual handle and spins the undogging wheel. Laidlaw points to the red light blinking over the door.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: You’ve got a fire in there.

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: Don’t go in! He yanks the hatch open. Smoke rolls. He peers into the hot box.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Lights are out in there... Pierce grabs an EBS unit and a handlight off the wall and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Laidlaw curses, pulls the second shotgun from the hatch -- it closes -- grabs an EBS and follows Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce steps down into about two feet of water, his flashlight stabbing through the thick smoke that fills the "Hot Box". As he starts wading through the knee-deep water, Laidlaw comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Goddamn it! You’ve compromised the whole station. There’s procedures for dealing with...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Piss on procedure. They look at each other, then Laidlaw shrugs as if to say "what the fuck" and hands Pierce a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (continuing - over his shoulder to Valdez) Dr. Valdez, what the fuck does this 1138 look like?

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Well, it’s a segmented exoskeltoid, roughly symmetrical...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) I mean...does it have teeth or what?

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Oh...yes. Several thousand very sharp teeth.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (under his breath) You had to ask. Suddenly, Pierce freezes as his flashlight beam picks up something floating in the water.

dialogues.speaker: JERKINS GOO
dialogues.text: Pierce’s beam plays over_a_ large clump of blood and goo, coming to rest on a face recognizable only by the broken pair of glasses that hangs near the end.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: It’s Dr. Jerkins...I think. As Pierce looks up A_BLACK WRITHING SHAPE SUDDENLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and Laidlaw SHOUT in fear, staggering back.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: They both fire at the shape, blasting it down into the water. The gunshots ECHO through the small corridor for a moment as Valdez yells:

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: Did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (grinning) Yeah, I think I killed it. Pierce prods the thing carefully with his shotgun, then picks up the riddled body of a creature, shining his light on it. Valdez peers down from the hatch, takes one look, and:

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: No, that’s 1257. It can’t hurt you. Pierce tosses the ugly motherfucker back in the water.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Goddamn right. He and Laidlaw ease through the cut-out hatch into the bio-lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce sweeps his flashlight across the lab, cutting through the sprinkler system’s rainy drizzle. One side of the lab is burned, covered in a blanket of foam. Some of the specimen tanks are broken open, others have been blackened from the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: WE HEAR
dialogues.text: zzzzzzt! POW! crackle. The flashlight beam follows the NOISE, coming to rest on the power control bus. It has been smashed. Sparks still arc from the loose wires. Insulation still burns.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Here’s the cause of the fire.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Looks like something smashed into it. He looks over the control panel, finds the EMERGENCY BATTERY switch, and flips it ON. . Harsh red emergency lights flicker on, giving them a better view. They search the lab.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Collins? Collins... There is no sign of her.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Pierce...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Pierce. A beat as Laidlaw looks for something else to say. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (sighs) Norris was right...Christ, what a mess. I better go call topside...tell them we have a problen. He looks at Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (continuing) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Okay,..stay sharp. Laidlaw turns and leaves the lab. Pierce watches him go. He leans up against one of the larger plex specimen containers, the back of his shirt wiping away some of the foam and carbon.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: In the specimen tank, breathing off an EBS unit. She looks out.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Totally unaware that Collins is right behind hin. Suddenly a loud THUMPING on the tank propels him to his feet, shotgun up and ready as he spins. He sees Collins and can’t believe it. Setting the shotgun down he climbs up on top of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Pierce reaches into the tank and grabs Collins’ wrists and pulls her up. She grins, their eyes lock.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Nice timing. My EBS unit was almost empty.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Pierce softens, a wave of relief rushes over his face. He holds her gaze for a moment, it looks like they might embrace. Then Pierce breaks the spell...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Don’t mention it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laidlaw sits at the computer console, typing in a communication to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: REQUEST PROCEDURE
dialogues.text: Laidlaw presses the SEND button and sits back. A second later, the monitor types back:

dialogues.speaker: ///STANDBY///
dialogues.text: There is a long pause. Then:

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: What is directive 7-12? Laidlaw scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Looks like some plan for dealing with escaped lab specimens.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: As Laidlaw types.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTIVE 7-12
dialogues.text: There is another pause as Laidlaw waits for a reply. Suddenly, the monitor goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Looks like we’re on our own,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins and Pierce are reworking the power bus control panel.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: _ That thing smashed the shit out of main junction. Some of the standby circuts are still good...won’t hold a full load. PIERCE . It’1l be enough until topside can get a repair team down here.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: You think we’re going home?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. As ‘soon as we find this 11l-whatever and put it back in it’s cage. Collins face turns ashen.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (worried) Didn’t you kill it?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: No...haven’t seen it. Don’t even know what it looks like.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: You mean it’s still loose... Collins stops working as horrible realization crawls over her. She rotates her head around slowly as Pierce continues to work. COLLINS P.O.V. As she PANS around the Bio-Lab looking for...

dialogues.speaker: RIPPLE
dialogues.text: -.-a small black thing resting quietly just below the surface of the water It could be anything it of debris...anything. Coll ins freezes. a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce starts to say something to Collins when he notices she is standing perfectly still. Collins quietly points in the direction of the little ripple. Pierce stares hard at the spot for a long moment. IT Moves, Pierce turns back to Collins, mouthing a question without making a sound.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (only moving lips) Is that it? Collins nods. Pierce looks back to the specimen tank where he had set down his shotgun. He’d never make it. Pierce tosses his thumb behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (only moving lips) Let’s get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 32 Collins nods again. She carefully shifts her footing, angling her body towards the exit. She and Pierce take a careful step towards the door. The thing beneath the water TURNS SHARPLY.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (harsh whisper) It’s on to us...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Go! Collins: and Pierce highstep through the water, moving quickly for the "Hot Box". The thing beneath the surface takes off, moving quickly in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and Collins doubletime through the "Hot Box", splashing through the water as they go.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIPPLE , 5
dialogues.text: As it moves into the "Hot Box", bearing down on them.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 5
dialogues.text: Pierce stumbles slightly and Collins pulls him along, neither one of them bothering to look back. And it’s a good thing because the ripple is picking up_Speed...moving in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Collins then Pierce jump through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: HATCH 6
dialogues.text: As the ripple swims right up to the hatchway, Pierce’s hand hits the CLOSE button.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The hatch reverberates as 1138 SLAMS against it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Laidlaw, Craven, and Valdez are a little surprised to see Collins but before they can say anything:

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Can it get through the hatch?

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: It will eventually.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: This blow puts a dent in the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Let’s get...while the...gettin’s good.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Saddle up.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The hatch is bending in more.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Pierce doesn’t need any further incentive. He rushes to the docking bay hatch.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: He begins to lift, the others join hin.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The hatch warps from the blow, retaining bolts SQUEAL as they are pulled from the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As they pull up the door, but there’s too many cooks, someone’s hand slips and door CRASHES back down.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The "Hot Box" hatch is pushing out from the sides.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As Laidlaw turns to Valdez and Craven.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Give us some room! (to Pierce and Collins) On three...one...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (continuing) o+etwo...

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...three! They heave, forcing the hatch up with a sickening SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 35 Laidlaw motions Craven and Valdez through.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The "Hot Box" hatch CRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As Collins, Pierce, and finally Laidlaw moves through the hatch as the others hold it open. The docking bay hatch SLAMS back down...

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: -.-just as the "Hot Box" hatch falls to the deck with a CLANG! Water rushes into the control room. “INT. BIO-LAB - DOCKING BAY AIRLOCK - CONTINOUS ACTION Laidlaw looks back when he hears the Hot Box hatch fall, he’s amazed at 1138’s strength. Valdez and Craven are the first into the airlock, followed by Collins, then Pierce. Laidlaw brings up the rear... .-.-accidentally bumping the shotgun, knocking it down. + The hatch CRASHES down on Laidlaw’s back. He SCREAMS. Pierce and Collins rush back to him, trying to lift the hatch, but with Laidlaw wedged in the hatchway, they can’t get enough leverage.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: 1138 is beginning to work on the next hatch. Pierce and Collins heave against the airlock hatch. Laidlaw groans, blood running from the corners of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM HATCH
dialogues.text: The control room hatch is bending from 1138’s successive blows.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Laidlaw can hear 1138 battering his way through the control room hatch. He tries to push Pierce away.

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Forget it!’ My back is broken!

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (straining) Lift!

dialogues.speaker: LAIDLAW
dialogues.text: Pierce! That thing’s going to break through any second! Save yourselves! Get out of here! That’s an order!

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (pulling on the hatch with all his might) Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The bottom of the control room hatch punches from the sill, rivets flying.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Pierce strains, frantic now. Laidlaw coughs violently, Pierce glances down. A look passes between them and Pierce suddenly realizes...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: No!tiit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 Pierce dives for the Laidlaw’s arm, but too late -- Laidlaw punches the FLOOD switch on the airlock control. WOOSH! Sea-water starts to pour into the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: He pounds the airlock controls, trying to shut off the flood, but it won’t respond. He spins to the hatch, hauling on it with all his might, water cascading over him. Water pours into the minisub. Pierce keeps trying to lift the hatch. Collins grabs his arn.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: No! Water splashes over Laidlaw’s head.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: You can’t help him! Collins drags Pierce back into the minisub, SLAMMING the hatch tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pierce listens in anguish to the WATER as it fills the airlock. Collins moves to the main control panel, grim.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: We've got to pump this water out. Pierce, start the engines. CLOSE ON PIERCE -- Blank. In his mind he can hear Laidlaw dying on the other side of the fucking hatch.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: pi ' (continuing; sharply) erce. Pierce moves to the pilot’s seat, firing up the engines, numb. Collins starts the pumps, looks up at Pierce -- he still can’t believe what just happened. He suddenly, violently pulls the release lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the minisub detaches from the bio-lab airlock. It hangs motionless, then suddenly surges away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce powers the sub away from the lab. Valdez and Craven grab for hand-holds as the sub lurches forward. Pierce, looks out the viewport at the airlock. Collins watches him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: There was nothing you could do.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: He was my friend! He deserved better than to die like that! Then...

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Fuck it... He jams on the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it sails for the distant DeepSTAR 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richardson is stacking cases of equipment and luggage by the docking bay airlock when he hears the SOUNDS of the the DSRV arriving. Richardson punches the videocom.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (into videocom) They’re back.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (filtered - 0.S.) On my way. The airlock hatch opens with a loud HISS. Valdez and Craven climb out, followed by Pierce and Collins. Norris enters the docking bay. She looks at the others. They stare back, limp. Emotionless. Norris looks for the right words. There are none. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (to everybody) Get your gear together...we’re going home.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: When did the order come down?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: It hasn’t yet. Snyder’s calling topside with a request for extraction right now. But I want to be ready to _Start decompression the moment the order comes.

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: Great. The sooner we get out of here, the better. And with that, Pierce exits the docking bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snyder is typing in a message on the keyboard, an exasperated look on his face. Snyer knows his shit about communications and computers. Right now: though, he isn’t making much progress. Pierce glances at him on his way to his quarters.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: What did topside say about Laidlaw? Snyder throws up his hands is disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven’t ‘said’ anything. I keep sending a signal but all I get back is this bullshit! He gestures to the monitor. —

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Pierce is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: What the fuck does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Beats me.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Try it again. Snyder’s fingers fly across the keyboard as he types in a message then presses the SEND button.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Snyder looks up at Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Something’s fucked up somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: I checked all the... (hears something on his headset) ..-hang on. Snyder cocks his head, quickly adjusting the volume on his headset.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sonar contact!

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: On the surface...no, wait! It’s leaving the surface...headed towards us.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Rescue sub?

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Too small...maybe a one or two man sub...wait! There’s another one.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Put it on the speaker. Snyder flips a switch and communications is filled with the SOUND of the SONAR. WE HEAR a distant SPLASH followed by a HISSING.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Shit! There’s another one. Topside is sending a whole fleet to take us home. Pierce is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Not likely. Punch up a visual as soon as the first one is in range. As Snyder punches up the visual sonar, Collins walks past. Pierce pulls her over.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Hey, check this out...see if you can tell what it is. Collins studies the visual sonar as it comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: SONAR
dialogues.text: As an animated diagram of the ocean above DeepSTAR 6 boots up. A small blip is dropping down to the center of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Can you get an ID off that? Snyder punches in a command to the computer. Sidebar information about the size and shape of the object appears next to the blip.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: (reading off screen) Metal cylinder...two meters long...one meter wide... . Collins realizes what they’ve been listening to...

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: . (realizing) Oh, sweet Jesus Christ... She punches the videocom.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (continuing - yelling) »+.DEPTH CHARGE!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A depth charge EXPLODES!

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: The explosion rocks the station. Snyder grabs onto the console as Pierce and Collins tumble back. Lights dim and flicker in the station, computer displays blink off, then on again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norris is thrown to the deck. Craven and Valdez are pelted with medical instruments as.a shelf pulls from the wall. Norris scrambles to the videocon.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Damage control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Norris’ voice CRACKLES through the speaker, Pierce and Collins scramble to their feet, racing for the damage control board.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Snyder, run a hull check! But Snyder ignores him. He’s trying to pry the top off his pill bottle, his hands shaking badly.

dialogues.speaker: DAMAGE CONTROL BOARD
dialogues.text: A computer monitor constantly displays the various systems aboard DeepSTAR 6. The computer is showing sidebar information about the damage incurred.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE AND COLLINS
dialogues.text: As they run up to the damage control board, Richardson dashes in from the docking bay.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: We’ve got a pressure leak in section seven...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: I’1l get the gear! He runs off into the docking bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valdez pulls an overturned equipment cart off of Craven. She is bleeding badly from a cut over her eye. —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A depth charge EXPLODES over the docking bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richardson is gathering some equipment together when the shock of the explosion knocks him to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snyder’s pills go flying, scattering across the deck and falling through the grating. Pierce and Collins grab onto a support beam, as the explosion causes the station to shudder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cargo sub is blasted loose from its docking ring mooring and sinks to the sea floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS go off as water begins to spray from the cargo sub’s hatch. Richardson jumps to the hatch, fighting the water as he tries to re-seal the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Pierce scans the damage control board.

dialogues.speaker: DAMAGE CONTROL MONITOR . 10
dialogues.text: The oxygen system display is a row of tanks, each colored in blue. As the next depth charge hits...

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The display is a blur of static as another ‘depth charge rocks the station. An ALARM starts to SHREIK. CLOSEUP - PRESSURE GAUGE as the needle drops quickly to zero.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: He checks the computer display, two more tanks have turned red.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: They’ve hit the oxygen system...we’re losing pressure!

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: One of the docking bay support struts breaks free, crashing to the deck with a loud metal CLANG. Richardson springs to the strut -- above him the hull is beginning to bend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins has seen the strut fall. She runs to help Richardson. She stumbles across Snyder, still on his hands and knees, looking for his pills. Norris gropes her way through the hatch from sick bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce!

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Over here! Give me a hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins drags the torch set over to the broken support strut. As Richardson lifts the strut, she fires up the torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pierce and Norris frantically attempt to stem the sudden loss of air pressure.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (to Norris) Patch in the trunk valve, see if we can hold pressure in the system.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (trying it) Negative! I’m sealing off the loop. (does it ) Shit! No pressure! The lines must be ruptured! An ALARM CLAXON BLEATS furiously. 107° EXT. DEEPSTAR 6 Another depth charge EXPLODES!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The medical bay rocks. Valdez gropes through the wreckage of the medical supplies for something to bandage Craven’s bleeding scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and Norris can’t stop the loss of air.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: See if you can find where the leak is!

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 46 10 10 10 10 10  47 Pierce snatches up the keyboard and starts to type in some quick commands. But he can’t make the system work the way Snyder can.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck...I can’t make it work! Where’s Snyder?! He looks over at Snyder, who is trying to dig a pill out from between the cracks.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (continuing-yelling) Snyder, Goddamnit! Get over here and help us! Snyder looks up, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a depth charge EXPLODES over the crew’s quarters. The hull caves in. 111 INT. CREW’S QUARTERS 11 As the bulkhead collapses. Hundreds of gallons of water rush inside. The hatch automatically slams down, sealing with a HISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pipes burst, spraying water onto electrical consoles. Sparks shoot out. Norris reaches over to turn valves, stemming the flow of water. Pierce tries to make the computer system work but he is obviously lost. He looks back at Snyder.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Snyder, for God’s sake...help me!

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 48 Suddenly, Snyder staggers to his feet. He stumbles over to Pierce and takes the keyboard away from hin. With badly shaking hands he starts to type. CLOSE ON THE DISPLAY -- As another tank goes from blue to red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richardson jams a packing case against the wall, Collins jumping up on it with her torch. He holds the strut in place as she starts to weld the strut to the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Collins grabs the strut to keep from falling. The hull above her warps dangerously.

dialogues.speaker: BOOMII
dialogues.text: The whole station is plunged into darkness. Lights and consoles sputter, fail, sputter. Finally they come back on. Richardson is on the floor. Collins still clings to the strut, grimly welding it in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norris attacks an electrical fire with an extinguisher. . . Try as he might, even Snyder’s magic fingers can’t stem the destruction. He turns to Pierce, frantic.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: We’re fucked! The whole system is coming apart and there’s nothing we can do!

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Pierce, we need that air to decompress!

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Not to mention, breathe.... Then he realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Hold it, hold it. Listen... He slaps a switch to kill the ALARMS. The station is suddenly, eerily, quiet -- only the rasping WHOOSH of Norris’ extinguisher and the HISS of Collin’s torch.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (continuing) They’ve stopped... ON THE DISPLAY -- The last tank goes red.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: The oxygen is all gone. It’s all fucking gone... Pierce speaks quietly, angrily.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Well, at least now we know what directive 7-12 is. Richardson and Collins drag in from the docking bay. Collins removes her welding mask.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, that’s the ballgame, folks.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Fuck it! Let’s cast off in the escape pod and go! ° PIERCE (shaking his head) Without the oxygen we can’t decompress. (looking at the others) And if we can’t decompress, we can’t leave the station.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: How long can we last?

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: There’s enough ambient air in the station for a couple of hours. Richardson is studying the status board.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Pierce, look here. Pierce turns as he points to the board.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (continuing) This indicates that the exchanger is still functioning.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s great. The only problem is that’s not on line and the main is ruptured.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: So what’s the problem? We could reroute the main through the bypass and patch the oxygen through the airlock pressure system.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (starting to get excited) Yeah, that would work...

dialogues.speaker: DIVE SUIT
dialogues.text: WE SEE the name "RICHARDSON" -- stenciled on white metal.

dialogues.speaker: THE DIVE SUIT 11
dialogues.text: The dive suit is a pressure-tight shell just big enough for one man, with joints for movement and a large viewing port in the headpiece. It looks like Robbie the Robot. Valdez, Craven, and Norris look on as Collins and Pierce help Richardson into his dive suit. Collins watches as Richardson rolls up the drawing his daughter did and stuffs it in his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (off her look) For luck... Then Richardson hoists himself inside as Norris steps up.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Watch yourself out there.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (squirming into the suit) It’s a walk in the park. 117 INT. DIVE SUIT il Richardson has "customized" the interior of his dive suit. Taped to the inside of the helmet are photos of his wife and daughter. A pair of miniature, pink fuzzy dice hang near the atmosphere controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins checks that Richardson’s tool basket is loaded and secure. At the monitoring panel, Snyder switches on the diving suit’s video assist system. The camera mounted on Richardson’s helmet comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR 11
dialogues.text: As Snyder turns away, walking over to check the camera. His face looms up on the monitor, distorted by the wide angle effect.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 12
dialogues.text: Collins presses a button and an electric winch on a track in the ceiling automatically picks up Richardson’s dive suit. With an electronic WHIRR, — the winch starts along the track towards the " airlock.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 52 On the other side of the basement, the massive hatch to the diving well starts to open automatically. Snyder punches up the oxygen exchanger blueprints on a computer terminal. Pierce looks over the electronic blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: TERMINAL 12
dialogues.text: A schematic of the oxygen exchanger flickers past. One area is highlighted in flashing red with sidebar information describing the problem.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (pointing at screen) He has to seal off the leak then reroute the mains through the bypass. We’ll patch the bypass through the airlock control here and route it up to the decompression chamber. (to Snyder) I’m going to need a hard copy of this. Snyder presses a button and a color copy of the blueprint zips out. He hands the copy to Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (to Valdez) Give me a hand with the deck.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 12
dialogues.text: Pierce and Valdez start to pull up small sections of the deck, exposing an extensive labyrinth of pipes and wiring. The winch stops. Ricahrdson’s diving suit swing directly over the open diving well. The winch WHIRRS again, gently lowering Richardson into the dive well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a loud metallic THUD, the heavy diving suit comes to a rest on the bottom of the airlock. winch automatically disconnects from the suit, the cable snaking back up through the open hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The The dive well hatch closes automatically, sealing with a HISS.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Hatch secure. He’s all set to get wet. A speaker above Richardson’s monitor BOOMS with his voice.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (filtered) Let her rip. Collins steps over to a panel: AIRLOCK CONTROL. CLOSEUP - FLOOD button, as Collins presses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud HISS sounds as water splashes up and over the view ports on the DIVING suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airlock door slides open and Richardson steps out onto the ocean floor. Work lights on the diving suit cast pools of brilliant light. lies the absolute blackness of the deep ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond Norris, Craven, and Snyder watch the Richardson’s P.O.V. monitor as his voice CRACKLES speaker.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (filtered) I’m clear of the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Richardson moves away from the airlock, the lights on the station grow dimmer. Soon he is surrounded by total darkness. His breath is labored, each step is an-effort. Suddenly, a large black object begins to materialize in his path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen flickers with static.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (filtered) ..-Something up ahead... But the monitor only shows a grey-black muddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black object reveals itself to be a structure the size of a small building, criss-crossed with an elaborate network of pipes, junctions and valves intersecting and branching off from each other, a plumber’s nightmare. Air spills from broken pipes in huge fountains.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: ...it’s the oxygen exchanger.

dialogues.speaker: .INT. BASEMENT
dialogues.text: The screen is fuzzy.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (filtered) Okay, I’m at the recirculation mains. Where do I cut? Pierce looks over the blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Find ENZ-6538.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richardson scans the exchanger, his light coming to rest on a large main -- ENZ-6538 -- nestled in between smaller pipes.

dialogues.speaker: . RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Yeah...I’ve got it.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (filtered) That’s your main, cut it where it splits off and use the good end to patch into BNC-34. Richardson reaches into his tool basket for his torch and fires it up. Bubbles spew from its nozzle as he starts to cut the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Richardson’s torch cuts through the main, Pierce starts to reroute the bypass. ("Hand me that wrench, etc.")

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Is he through the main yet? A burst cf snow blurs the monitor image. Static obscures Richardson’s reply.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: (into headset) Say again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torch cuts through the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: (filtered) Yeah, I’m through. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce consults the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Go ahead and patch it to BNC-34.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richardson is patching the main when something gets his attention. He looks over at a filter vent. The cover has been torn off (blown off) and a tiny trickle of bubbles slip from the opening.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image starts to break up.

dialogues.speaker: . NORRIS
dialogues.text: Snyder, fix this thing... Snyder adjusts the set but the static grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richardson shuts down the torch, turning towards the vent.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: I thought I heard something. He peers over into the vent.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Richardson curses under his breath, shutting down the vent.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARDSON
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just a bypass venting. He turns back back to the pipe... -»-AND SOME BIG UGLY MOFO JUMPS IN HIS FACE!!!!

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR 13
dialogues.text: AS 1138 LEAPS TOWARDS RICHARDSON’S CAMERA. The image breaks up, Richardson’s SCREAM becoming garbled with the static.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 14
dialogues.text: Everyone freezes for an instant. Then:

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Tell him to return to the airlock. But Snyder is paralyzed. Norris snatches the headset away from him, yelling into it.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Return to the airlock!

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: I’m going out there... She races for the other dive suit.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (into the headset) Richardson!!!

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: The noise at the airlock door causes everyone to freeze. Pierce springs to the dive well hatch and peers into the small viewport in the top. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: It’s him! Collins presses the dive well OPEN button and the massive hatch swings up. Richardson’s helmet comes to the surface. Pierce drops to the floor next to the helmet, wiping the faceplate with his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: XIN THE DIVING SUIT 14
dialogues.text: Pierce looks in through the viewport.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (muffled) - Hang on, Buddy! We/’1ll have you out in a second! Richardson looks back with a blank and distant stare.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 14
dialogues.text: Pierce jumps up, grabbing the hook from the winch. He fastens it to the back of Richardson’s helmet. Collins hits the switch and the winch starts to pull the diving suit out of the airlock. Suddenly Craven screams. Richardson’s diving suit has been torn in half, the bottom part missing just below the arms. Cables and tattered flesh hang loosely from underneath as water and blood drip into the open airlock.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Holy Mother of God! Stunned silence as the winch pulls the suit to the end of the boom, stopping with a loud metallic CLANG. Something in the bits of floating debris catches Valdez’s eye -- the drawing that Richardson’s daughter did of him, torn and spattered with blood. He bends down to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: THE GAPING BLACK MAW OF 1138 BREAKS THE SURFACE OF
dialogues.text: THE WATER, biting off Valdez’ d_at t) Ss SCREAMING, Valdez draws back a bloody stump. He staggers back across the deck, slamming into the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS AND CRAVEN . . 14
dialogues.text: Norris and Craven both leap for Valdez. Norris grabs his bloody arm but it slips from her grip. Craven grabs it in two hands. Propping him up with one hand, Norris rips the sleeve off his jumpsuit to fashion s tant

dialogues.speaker: ON THE AIRLOCK 14
dialogues.text: Pierce and Collins throw themselves on the hatch, forcing it closed. A black claw forces its way out of the hatch, fighting for leverage. Collins picks up a wrench and starts beating the Claw back. unks oO @ Shell break off, spraying them_in the face. The claw retreats back, Pierce and Collins force the hatch shut an it. Dead silence. Pierce and Collins heave from exertion. Norris and Craven are already guiding Valdez to the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: The impact causes the hatch to shudder violently. They scramble from the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: The second impact shatters the viewport.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: The third impact torques the hatch hinge.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE/COLLINS
dialogues.text: (to Snyder) Purge! Hit the fucking purge!! Snyder is shaking, lips quivering with fear. His mind is grinding gears. Suddenly, he finds first. CLOSEUP - PURGE button as Snyder’s hand slaps it. A deafening ROAR fills the basement as compressed air is quickly funnelled into the dive well. Pierce and Collins stagger back against the railing as water geisers out of the shattered viewport like a fountain.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: The hatch starts to spray water from the edge.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: Water EXPLODES out of the dive well. The hatch rips free and flys open, pinning Collins against the railing. Pierce jumps over to her and tries to pull her free. Water sprays from the dive well, several inches already cover the floor. 1138 rises up, shrouded in a spray of water. eee SPE Eee Sprey eee The dive well still ROARS, the water level rapidly rising. Pierce pushes against the hatch with all his might but it won’t budge. Collins is trapped.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: But Snyder’s clutch has burned out. He panics and claws for the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 61 Craven is standing on the ladder, pushing Valdez through when Snyder pulls her off. She falls back to the deck, landing in the water with a SPLASH! Snyder flies up the ladder and through the hatch. Craven looks over at the dive well. 1138 slithers out of the dive well and onto the deck. AEs Pierce is still trying to free Collins.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (yelling over the noise)

dialogues.speaker: SHUT IT OFF
dialogues.text: Craven staggers through the waist high water towards the dive well control panel. CLOSE UP - PURGE BUTTON as Craven turns it off. The water spray from the dive well fizzles out. Pierce pushes with both feet against the hatch. The hatch falls forward with a WHUMP! Collins is freed. Across the room, the automatic winch has returned Richardson’s suit to the rack. It releases it and the half-suit CRASHES to the deck i ver into the water and sinking with a SPLASH. 1138 sinks beneath the surface, swimming for Craven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She screams, scrambling for the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: Pierce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norris rushes out of sick bay, hearing the muffled SHOUTS from the lab below. She looks up in alarm, moving towards the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 62 Snyder grabs her, mad with fear, pinning her against the bulkhead in an iron grip.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: No! It’s down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce hustles Collins towards the ladder as he rushes to help Craven. Craven flails at the ladder but 1138 overtakes her, grabbing her in it’s giant maw.

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: (screaming) Pierce! Help me... Pierce reaches for her, but 1138 pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: CRAVEN
dialogues.text: (continuing-pleading) ...please...help me... 1138 drags her under the water. Pierce looks helplessly at the water where Craven went under. Collins calls to him from the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Pierce! Come on! Pierce turns and scrambles for the ladder. Just as his feet hit the rungs...

dialogues.speaker: MADLY
dialogues.text: Pierce leaps up the next few rungs, pressing hard into Collins. .

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: I can’t the hatch is locked!

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 63 Collins pounds on the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (continuing-yelling) Snyder! Open the hatch!!! Pierce glances down at the bottom of the ladder. 1138 circles the bottom of the ladder, it’s spin backbone just breaking the water. Suddenly, it tilts it’s ugly head skyward and HISSES, exposing several rows of sharp teeth -- a stinking, black pit of violent death.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (screaming at the hatch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norris and Snyder hear the muffled cries of Collins and Pierce through the thick hatch. Norris starts for the hatch again but Snyder stops her.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: No! You/’ll let it in! Norris tries to break free of Snyder’s grasp but his fear has made him strong. Suddenly, she relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: You’re right...there’s nothing we can do. Snyder releases his grasp a bit, whispering...

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Let’s get in the escape...

dialogues.speaker: POW
dialogues.text: Norris sends Snyder spiraling with a right cross to the chin then quickly crosses to the hatch cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce watches fom the ladder as 1138 works it’s mouth, testing the ladder’s rungs, getting ready for the big meal. . Not a pretty sight. With the sudden WOOSH of compressed air, the hatch swings open. Collins and Pierce scramble through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins SLAMS the hatch shut, dogging it forcefully. Pierce collapses on top of it, his chest heaving.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: It got Craven. Collins rises up, her eyes meeting with Snyder’s. Snyder gives a slight start. Trying to stand and - move back at the same time, he bumps into the map table. But Collins is already on her feet, moving fast and low...

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (thickly) You son-of-a-BITCH! +.-punching him in the face on the word "bitch." Snyder tumbles backwards over the map table. Collins leaps after him, her fists flying. She straddles Snyder, her fists slamming into his face again and again. Blood spatters from Snyder’s nose. Pierce grabs Collins from behind and pulls her off Snyder. Snyder tires to get to his feet, instead staggering back against a console. He hangs there, trying to stem the flow of blood from his mashed nose.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: What..what did you do that for? Collins stares back furious as Pierce shuffles her into the medical bay.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Get your shit together, Snyder...or next time I won’t hold her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valdez, conscious but weak, lays on the operating table. erris is cauterizing the stum ot probe searing Valdez’s esh wi a HISS, like drops of water on a hot stove. — Collins hands instruments to her, wiping Valdez’s sweat-soaked face with a wet cloth. Valdez GASPS, trying not to show the pain. Norris looks up at Collins.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: The shot’s wearing off. Prep another five cc’s. She does.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: We have to stop that thing.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Relax... He strains to look at Norris.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: I should have listened...I should have Known...

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Don’t exert yourself. I want you to stay calm -- take slow, deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: -..it’s all my fault that those people have died.

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 66 Collins comes over with the syringe, taking Valdez by the shoulders to calm him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Take it easy...you’re in shock. Noris thumps the syringe with her forefinger then quickly injects Valdez in his good arm. . The drug takes affect almost immediately.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: We found it...a new species... in the crater. I thought...I could use some of its characteristics as a work animal... an underwater beast of burden. Fantastic growth rate...strength... speed... (he slows) +..too hostile. I wanted to keep... sample of its genetic material...thought we could cross it with...gentler traits. But topside...ordered me to save the organism intact.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Then it wasn’t your fault.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: (slower) I knew it was...too dangerous to keep...I should’ve destroyed it. But I was afraid...I would be...taken off...the project... Valdez’s eyes grow glossy.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: (almost gone) Forgive me....Louise.... Valdez falls asleep. Norris gets up, stripping off her bloody gloves. She runs some water in the sink, washing her face.  67

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Don’t exert yourself. I want you to stay calm -- take slow, deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: .-.it’s all my fault that those people have died. Collins comes over with the syringe, taking Valdez by the shoulders to calm hin.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Take it easy...you’re in shock. Noris thumps the syringe with her forefinger then quickly injects Valdez in his good arm. The drug takes affect almost immediately.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: We found it...a new species... in the crater. I thought...I could use some of its characteristics as a work animal... an underwater beast of burden. Fantastic growth rate...strength... speed... (he slows) -..too hostile. I wanted to keep... sample of its genetic material...thought we could cross it with...gentler traits. But topside...ordered me to save the organism intact.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Then it wasn’t your fault.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: (slower) I knew it was...too dangerous to keep...I should’ve destroyed it. But I was afraid...I would be...taken off...the project... Valdez’s eyes grow glossy.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: (almost gone) Forgive me....Louise.... Valdez falls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 Norris gets up, stripping off her bloody gloves. She runs some water in the sink, washing her face. She turns as Pierce and Snyder enter the medical bay.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Valdez) How is he?

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve done what I can...he’ll be okay but we have to get him up top.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yeah...along with the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: How much air do we have left?

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Not much...whatever air is left in the station, enough for an hour or so, no more.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Richardson got the oxygen exchanger back on line but that fucking thing got inside before I could patch it into the decompression chanber.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Then we’ll just have to go back down and finish patching it in.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: With that thing down there?! No fucking way! We wouldn’t have a chance! I vote we cast off in the escape pod.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Don’t be an idiot. Without decompressing, we’d burst like a bunch of ripe melons.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (firmly) We have to go back down..without that oxygen we’ll die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 Pierce stands.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Then we’ll have to kill that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
