dialogues.text: Snyder comes in with four small cylinders tipped with stout needles -- SHARK DARTS. He dumps them next to Norris, and they start assembling the sectioned poles. The air in the station is getting thin and hot and everyone is starting to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: I could only find four of ’em...

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: They’1l have to do. Collins and Pierce are loading the shotguns when suddenly, Valdez appears in the hatchway.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: I want to go. Pierce and Collins exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (starts to shake her head) I don’t think...

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: I want to to kill that son-of-a- bitch. Norris looks over at Pierce. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (to Snyder) Give him a shark dart. Snyder hands Valdez a shark dart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 Valdez takes it in his only hand, studying it carefully.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: I’m not familar with how this works.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: It’s loaded with a CO2 cartridge. Just jab the needle into that thing and the gas blows him up like a balloon.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: We’ll sweep that lab in two teams. Pierce, you take Snyder and Dr. Valdez with you. Collins your with me. Snyder turns away to hide how badly he is shaking. Sitting on the padded examination table, he pretends to be intensely interested in his shark dart. Everyone starts for the exit, except Snyder.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Hey! These cartridges expired six months ago. These fucking things are out of date!

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Come on, quit fucking around. We’re running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: I’m not going down there with this defective piece of shit! Norris swells. She’s had about all of Snyder’s shit she can stand. She snatches up Snyder’s shark dart and points it at his crotch... ...then thrusts it into the padded surface of the examination table next to his thigh. Instantly, the loud HISS of ESCAPING GAS is heard. Snyder jumps off the examination table as the vinyl cover begins to bulge, popping off the upholstery buttons.

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 71 Snyder scrambles to avoid the rapidly inflating cover as the high pressure gas in the shark dart fills the padded top.

dialogues.speaker: PFOOM
dialogues.text: The vinyl is blown to shreds. Everyone looks at the wrecked examination table.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Let’s do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of DRIPPING WATER echoes through blackness. There is a slight THUD followed by a loud metallic CLICK as a small circle of light grows in the ceiling. Pierce pokes his head cautiously through the hatchway. He shines his dive light around the interior of the lab. It’s three-quarters full of seawater.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (to himself) Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce pulls his head out of the hatchway and looks up at the others.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: The dive well must be leaking...the lab is almost flooded. The others exchange nervous looks as Snyder whines:

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus Christ! That thing could be

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 72 anywhere down there! Screw this bullshit, let’s cast off in the pod...

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Stow that crap. (to Pierce) Go on. Pierce picks up his shotgun and starts to lower himself into the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (muttering) Navy...it’s not just a job...it’s an adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce comes down the ladder, slowly easing his body into the cold, dark seawater. Norris comes next, followed by Snyder. Collins helps Valdez bring up the rear. Pierce dips his dive light beneath the surface of the water, sweeping it back and forth slowly. He wades chest-deep across the lab towards the specimen tank. Snyder, his shark-dart poised high above his head, shuffles slowly to the right. Valdez sticks close behind him. Collins and Norris wade along the wall to the left, their lights and weapons held out in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Norris jabs forward with her shark-dart as Collins pumps three quick rounds through her shotgun. SCREAMS and SHOUTS fill the compartment as the black thing thrashes around in the water, the shark dart embedded in its skin, HISSING loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 Lights skew around the lab as Pierce shouts to be heard over the din:

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Hold up! Wait a minute! Hold it! The others quiet down one by one as they train their dive lights on-the dying black thing... +..a pair of dive suit woolies. It slowly turns, spilling air and sinking with a “GLUB. A moment of embarrassed silence.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (ruefully) I used up my shark dart.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Snyder, give her yours.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Fuck you! I ain’t staying down here without a weapon! Before Norris can respond...

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ
dialogues.text: You can have mine. Valdez quietly wades to Norris, and hands her his weapon. Pierce passes a couple of rounds to Collins who reloads her shotgun. Tentatively they begin the sweep again. Then, after a moment:

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: I think it split.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think you’re right. (then) I’m going down and patch in the bypass. Pierce hands his shotgun to Snyder. He braces himself, takes a breath, and dives under the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce dives down, searching with his light for the access panel. He finds it, setting his dive light on the deck. He gropes for the wrench and starts to reconnect a fitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of WATER DRIPPING, the others waiting, their breath showing in the bitter cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce tries to bolt a pipe together. The wrench slips with a loud metallic CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snyder jumps at the noise.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: What the fuck is he doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: WHOOSH
dialogues.text: They all have near heart attacks as Pierce bursts to the surface, panting:

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: It’s jammed... He breathes in deeply several times, then dives again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce really tugs on that mother and CLANG -- the wrench slips again. Finally, he gets the pipe in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~ It’s getting tense. Snyder swings his light back and forth, nervously. He’s coming apart.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 75 Norris and Collins are trying their best to stand an aggressive guard when... ...WHOOSH, Pierce comes up for air again.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Ta-da!

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: It’s patched in. We’re all set to...

dialogues.speaker: THE THING BURSTS UP BEHIND PIERCE
dialogues.text: ee ee eee Chaos. Dive lights flail in the darkness, slashing across the outline of the thing. Snyder’s nerve snaps. He drops Pierce’s shotgun and runs for the ladder... .+-his forgotten shark dart stabbing Valdez in the heart.

dialogues.speaker: VALDEZ 16
dialogues.text: HISSSSS -- Valdez looks down in horror as his chest expands, a SCREAM building in his oat as blood gurgles from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BLAPP
dialogues.text: Valdez’‘s left side explodes in a grisly shower of ribs and muscle tissue, Collins and Norris are spattered with blood and bits of lung.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 16
dialogues.text: Snyder scrambles for the ladder, stumbling against Norris as she rushes forward to throw her shark-dart.

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 76 The shark dart punctures the thing’s side, but hangs limply. The compressed gas escapes from ‘he wound causing it to thrash about in agony. Pierce backpedals as the thing sweeps towards him, its claws flailing. He ducks beneath the water as Collins fires her shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Two rounds punch through the thing’s shell with a stinging SNAP. Her third shot goes high, rupturing high pressure hoses. The hoses lash about as the thing pivots around in pain, HISSING madly. Its tail whips over its head.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Collins blows the end of its tail off. The thing SCREECHES . Pierce breaks the surface next to Collins and hustles her towards the ladder. Valdez’s body slips_bi h_ the surface of the water, his mouth frozen open in a cry of mute protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snyder scrambles through the hatch, racing for the escape pod. He reaches up, pulling on a large yellow handle in the ceiling marked:

dialogues.speaker: ///ESCBPE///ESCAPE///ESCAPE///ESCAPE///
dialogues.text: A ladder drops from the ceiling as Norris comes through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Snyder! Stop! “ He ignores her, climbing up, frantically unlocking the hatch to the escape pod. Norris grabs him by the waist. He turns and pounds her with a vicious backhand. She tumbles to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 164 165 166 77 He swarms up into the escape pod. Norris climbs up the escape pod ladder just as Snyder SLAMS the hatch in her face. She pounds on it, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Snyder, don’t be stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Snyder breaks the yellow and black safety seal and sets the switches to override. Norris’ VOICE carries faintly through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (muffled) Snyder! I am ordering you to stop! He ignores her, sheer panic driving his brain as he fumbles with the ESCAPE control, twisting it to ARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing finally sweeps the shark dart out of its side, charging after Pierce and Collins. They Scramble up through the hatch as it rips out the ladder inches below Pierce’s feet. =

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: As she hangs on the ladder in the short space between the escape pod and the command center as an ALARM CLAXON starts to bleat. She continues to bang on the hatch and scream, ignoring the big red warning stickers plastered around her:

dialogues.speaker: //CAUTION
dialogues.text: And now the lower hatch begins to automatically close. Norris is about to be trapped inside the docking ring.... .»..when suddenly, at the last second before she is pinned, strong arms reach up and pull her free.

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 78 She tumbles to the deck with Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snyder pushes the launch button.

dialogues.speaker: BLAMMO
dialogues.text: The explosive bolts fire simultaneously, rocking the escape pod and tossing Snyder back against his seat. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ceiling shudders with the EXPLOSION. The hatch to the escape pod warps, sending a shower of gas and debris. Water shoots past the seals, spraying Norris, Collins, and Pierce with terrific pressure. 169. EXT. DEEPSTAR 6 / EXT. ESCAPE POD —- SAME TIME 16 The pod tears free from DeepSTAR 6 in a flurry of massive air bubbles as it races to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water gushes from the hatch seals, spraying the electronic consoles and shorting them out. Sparks fly out as the lights flicker and dim. Pierce and the others crawl into the galley as the watertight doors start to close.

dialogues.speaker: .XINT. GALLEY 17
dialogues.text: The three of them slide through the airlock as the watertight door closes shut, sealing with a HISS. Norris sputters, coughing seawater from her lungs.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (coughing) That bastard...I’m going to kill him!

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 79 Pierce gazes at the ceiling as if he could see through it.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: He’s already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod rises from the seafloor at an ever increasing rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the speed builds, the interior begins to vibrate. Snyder struggles to hold onto his seat. CLOSEUP - DEPTH GAUGE as the needle starts to rise. Snyder looks out the small window in the upper hatch. Bubbles race by against a pitch black background. He giggles, a soft sound that builds as he pounds his seat arms, urging the pod to go faster. Snyder ignores the ALARM that goes off. ///DANGER/// .

The escape pod is really shaking now, but Snyder doesn’t care. He’s going home. DEPTH GAUGE - The needle rises faster. The escape pod lurches violently. Snyder throws out a hand to steady himself. It twitches. A_blister rises on the back o i and. Suddenly, khe blister grows larger ~~ it hecomes a.vein, pushing to the surface of his arm. Snyder watches, fascinated, as the vein races up his arm past his elbow... ~~ +-.then Snyder GASPS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 80 DEPTH GAUGE - Rising faster. WINDOW - The first glimmers of pale light.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: In agony. Blood seeping from his ears and nose. DEPTH GAUGE - Signing his death warrant.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP - Snyder’s eyes -- red and bulging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINDOW - Light streams in. The water -- azure blue.

dialogues.speaker: SNYDER
dialogues.text: Veins push out across his face, hi. les bursting, spraying out blood. His mouth opens in a tortured SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snyder’s SCREAM carries faintly through the thick escape pod hull. The SCREAM CUTS OFF as the top hatch window is suddenly wiped|with red. Silhouetted by the distant sun, wreathed in air bubbles and sparkling light, the escape pod sails on towards the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 This scene is currently under construction. They are running out of air. Pierce discovers that Collins is carrying his unborn chil In a desperate final effort to survive, Pierce formulates plan: He will swim through the flooded Command Center to the Docking Bay and bring the surviving mini-sub to the decompression chamber. Norris and Collins will swim to th medical bay and enter the decompression chamber from that end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce opens the door to the airlock and crawls inside.

dialogues.speaker: . PIERCE
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes... Both women nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (sighing) Well, here goes nothing. He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce sits in the tiny airlock, breathing deeply, filling his lungs with every atom of air they can hold. He hits the OPEN switch. The airlock quickly fills with swirling, frigid water. Pierce is completely immersed as the outer door slides open. He swims out into the blackness beyond.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Pierce swims across the almost fully flooded command center. He kicks under the map table and comes up next to the airlock door marked:

dialogues.speaker: DOCKING BAY
dialogues.text: A single red light shines from the control panel. He presses it. Nothing. Pierce give the button another try. Still nothing. Precious seconds tick past as he tries to figure the problem. Then, he kicks off from the bottom, swimming for the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce’s head breaks the surface of the water only six inches from the ceiling of the command center. Behind him the escape pod hatch is still leaking like mad. He takes several deep breaths and ducks down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce swims up to the door again. He pries open an access panel, using a crank to open the door manually. The airlock door slides open and Pierce swims in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce closes the door behind him, pressurizing the lock. As the water level drops beneath his chin, he takes several deep breaths and opens the next door. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and several gallons of water spill out into the bay. He gets to his feet, climbing into the accessway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce moves through the hatch, pulling it closed. He pulls himself into the pilot’s seat and straps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women have lapsed into sleep. Norris sits in Snyder’s chair, her feet drawn up underneath her. Collins lies on the floor. Norris’ head dips a little, then she falls, tumbling out of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Pierce...help me... Then, she remembers. She starts shaking Collins.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Wake up...wake up. But Collins is too far gone. Norris drags her over to the airlock, opens the door, and pushes her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norris climbs inside after Collins, closing the door. She gives Collins another shake -- no response. Norris punches the FLOOD control. Frigid water swirls around Collins and she awakens with a start. Her shout of protest is cut off as the water rises above their heads. Norris opens the outer door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norris and Collins swim out of the galley airlock, their flimsy undergarments billowing as they navigate through the mass of debris that was once the command center. They reach the medical bay airlock. Norris hits the OPEN switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 Nothing happens. Their lungs about to burst, Norris slams the switch again. A dreadful moment, then the hatch starts to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the harsh red of the emergency lights, an unholy torrent of water pours in from the open hatch. Collins pours into the medical bay, tumbling across the deck. Norris manages to grab the frame of the open hatch as the water thunders past her, tearing at her clothes. Her finger finds the "CLOSE" switch, pressing it. The hatch motor GRINDS as it tries to close, then stops as something jams in the doorway. A HUGE BLACK SHAPE SLIDES THROUGH THE WAY. The hatch SLAMS shut quickly, catching the thing by one claw. It _thrashes wildly, its tail sma Norris against bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce cranks the starter, an exasperated look on his face. Nothing. He hits it again, the starter WHINES but the turbine will not turn over.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shit... He cranks it again. He’d pump the gas pedal if it had one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water sprays through the narrow opening in the hatch as the thing flails with an unearth KEENING sound. Norris and Collins scramble away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 With a tremendous yank, tI is i off a claw, breaking loose. The hatch slams shut. Craw, breaking loose. Furious, the ing rises up, going for Collins. Collins backs away as Norris maneuvers down the bay. —_— Something catches her eye... ++.the defibrillator unit. She switches the unit on and grabs the shock paddies. CLOSE ON DEFIBRILLATOR -- as the capacitor begins to suck up the juice with a loud electric WHINE, the voltmeter counting up quickly by thousands: eee de ee Beebe erSeee

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS 19
dialogues.text: As the thing bears down on her.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Norris moves up behind it, holding the paddles out.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: Let’s see how you like this, you dumb, ugly, sack of fish shit... She slaps the paddles on the thing’s back. ZZZAPPiIL! Long sparks ARC across its shell, it SHRIEKS and recoils. The thing hunkers down, HISSING at Norris. CLOSE ON THE DEFIBRILLATOR -- as the capacitor begins charging again. 4 56 Gee Tee

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 19
dialogues.text: Collins hammers the controls to the decompression chamber but it refuses to open, an idiot light stating flatly:

dialogues.speaker: //WATER IN HOLD//
dialogues.text: The thing pauses, then sinks down, vanishing beneath the water. The capacitor continues its steady climb. 2+-12...13...14...15... A ripple races across the surface of the water towards Norris. SUDDENLY NORRIS IS GRABBED FROM BELOW. She’s slammed against the bulkhead, one of the paddles flies from her hand and SPLASHES into the water. Norris BELLOWS in rage and pain. Collins frantically pounds the little window in the hatch door. Norris kicks out, trying to stay on her feet, groping for the lost paddle. THE DEFIBRILLATOR -- WHINING in protest. 006 22..-23...624...25..6.

dialogues.speaker: NORRIS
dialogues.text: 194 The paddle in her hand dips dangerously close to the water.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Suddenly behind her, through the window, Pierce enters the decompression chamber. Only he doesn’t see what’s going on because he’s too busy wondering where the hell Norris and Collins are and why women can never be on time...

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 87 ...then he looks out the window. The hatch to the decompression chamber flies open and Pierce grabs Collins and hauls her inside. He starts for Norris.

dialogues.speaker: GET BACK
dialogues.text: Suddenly, she is yanked beneath the surface. ZZZZZZZZTTTTILIEL Lit = =Pow!!! There is a sharp electrical CRACK as the paddle hits the water. The power unit EXPLODES, sending a shower of sparks and debris. Pierce is thrown back into the decompression chamber. ZZZT!!! snap! Z2ZT!!! snap! Pow!!! The creature rises up, HISSING wildly as thousands of volt: hrough it. Lights and instrumentation EXPLODE. ZZZT!!! POW!!! snap! POW!!! Z22T!!! zzzT!}! Pierce slams the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: THE DECOMPRESSION CHAMBER
dialogues.text: Pierce and Collins watch the fireworks through the thick little window, sparks of electricity briefly illuminating their faces.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The thing convulses helplessly, thick smoke rolling off its shell. ZZZ2T! ZZZT! pow. snap. ZZZzzzzztt...

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 197 88 Finally, the last little spark fizzles out and the thing teeters over, falling into the water with a huge SPLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘ANGLE ON THE DECOMPRESSION CHAMBER - SAME TIME 198 199

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Collins and Pierce watch the creature die with rapt fascination. Suddenly, this gives way to tremendous joy as they begin jumping up and down. Finally, Pierce says something to Collins that makes her stop. ‘ She moves close, putting her arms around his neck. Their lips melt into one long passionate kiss as they slowly sink from in front of the window. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deep sea station looks peaceful, dim lights barely glowing in the deep, dark ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce and Collins lay in a tangled heap, asleep on the floor. Collins begins to stir, pulling free of Pierce’s arms. She opens her eyes and looks around the chamber as if she is unaware of where she is. Suddenly, full-consciousness seizes her and she freezes. Nothing. Collins looks at her watch then up at the control board for the chamber. A green light glows reassuringly:

dialogues.speaker: STANDBY
dialogues.text: Collins blinks in disbelief. She reaches over and presses a button on the panel. There is a slight delay as if the computer does not understand the question. Then the green light blinks again:

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN EMBARKATION
dialogues.text: A slight giggle escapes Collins. She grabs Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Wake up! Pierce, wake up! She rolls him over, face up, his features frozen in a blank and distant stare. She looks down in horror.

dialogues.speaker: ON PIERCE
dialogues.text: His chest cavity is a mass of swarming CRABS, feeding on his entrails.

dialogues.speaker: ON COLLINS
dialogues.text: As she SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: A depth charge explodes nearby, waking Collins with a SCREAM. It takes her a moment to realize where she is, then she looks at her watch. She grabs Pierce and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Another blast rocks the station and Pierce springs awake.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: The bastards! They’re doing it again. Aw shit!

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Pierce and Collins board the minisub, moving as quickly as they can in the thin air. Pierce climbs into the pilot’s seat, sets some switches, then crosses his fingers. He hits the starter. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Pierce and Collins hold fast as the bulkheads RATTLE violently. Pierce scrabbles for the starter and stabs it. Not a thing.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The minisub lurches. A gauge SMASHES.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) You sorry piece of SHIT! On "SHIT", Pierce SLAMS his fist into the console. The motor catches. Pierce lets out a WHOOP, gunning the motors.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Let’s get the HELL outta here! Pierce doesn’t need to be told. He jams on the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The explosion causes the minisub to pitch suddenly. Pierce is thrown hard against the bulkhead, loosing control of the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motors SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: The minisub plows full speed astern into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarms SHRIEK their warnings, the lights flicker wildly. Pierce jams the drive into full ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PROPELLER - as it hesitates, then spins furiously. The stern of minisub is wedged tight in a gaping hole in the side of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins works the damage control board, calling over her shoulder to Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: We’re stuck! Pierce swears under his breath as he leans hard on the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minisub tugs forward. The motor WHINES in protest.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Pierce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is wrapped around the bow of the

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: It SLAMS the side of the minisub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minisub shakes violently. Pierce pulls back on the stick, his fingers fumbling over the switches. Collins gropes for something to hang on to, then is thrown again as the minisub shudders. She drops to the deck, crawling forward, her hand finding the control for the mechanical arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE ARM -- as it comes to life, extending itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce rides the helm with everything he’s got. CLOSEUP - INSTRUMENT PANEL as motor temperature rises rapidly into the red zone. Collins tries to catch her breath, trembling from the lack of oxygen. The thing’s gaping mouth presses against the front viewport, trying to chew its wa inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minisub rises in a flurry of air bubbles, the thing plastered onto the bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 Collins smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Just like old times. An ALARM bleats out a sudden warning. Pierce checks his panel.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: We gotta leak...forward section. Collins glances forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEWPORT
dialogues.text: As water streams from the sides of the plastic cover.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Collins moves forward...

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Shit. Looks like a crack in the main viewport. ---pulling the cover off the viewport... -+-she screams.

dialogues.speaker: VIEWPORT
dialogues.text: THE THING’S MOUTH IS PRESSED HIDEOUSLY AGAINST THE VIEWPORT.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: As she recoils, moving away from the viewport.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: Pierce has had it with this shit. . He whips the ‘ throttle back to idle...

dialogues.speaker: FUCK IT
dialogues.text: .+.then jams it forward with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minisub gives a start then jumps forward. It tears free with a sickening metallic SCREECH, leaving its stabilizer fin embedded in the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Pierce steers the minisub away from the docking bay, he glances out his stern viewport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIERCE’S P.O.V. - As the depth charge drifts down slowly onto the top of the station.

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: The station EXPLODES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minisub vibrates violently as it is hammered by the explosion. Pierce fights to stay in control as Collins hangs on for dear life. The lights flicker, then die. After a moment, the vibrations subside and the lights blink back on. Pierce glances around the minisub, checking for structural damage. He looks at Collins and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Wow! What a ride, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 95 Collins manipulates the arn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP - FORWARD VIEWPORT as the mechanical arm moves toward the dark form of the thing like a silver dart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins is sweating bullets, gasping for air. A terrible GRINDING sound causes Pierce to jump. CLOSEUP - INSTRUMENT PANEL as the motor temperature gauge hits the end of the scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE PROPELLER -- as it suddenly halts, gas and debris shooting past the driveshaft bearing seals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce shuts down the motors -- too late. The minisub, powerless, is tossed about as the thing slams them again.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The lights flicker, sparks and flames leap from the control panel. Water begins to spray into the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP - FORWARD PORTHOLE -- the thing’s hideous mouth.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: concentrates fiercely, ignoring the violent pitching of the sub and the water that showers her.

dialogues.speaker: 2-DRAFT
dialogues.text: 228 j%INT./EXT. DSRV-1 CLOSEUP - FORWARD PORTHOLE -- the clawed end of the mechanical arm appears in front of the thing’s mouth. °229 INT. DSRV-1 Collins drives the claw straight into the thing’s mouth and squeezes the control grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE claw closes, catching the Caer The mechanical claw crushes the thin mouth organs. Blood spurts ito the wates, The thing goes berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce grabs his seat with both hands to hold on. CLOSEUP - DEPTH GAUGE, the needle soaring for the surface. Collins squeezing the control grip as tight as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP - FORWARD PORTHOLE -- the thing convulses to_get away from the sub. It twists violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole sub rolls completely over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything not bolted down is briefly airborne. The monitor panel crashes down, pinning Collins. She bellows -- a loud angry SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 97 Above Pierce, an emergency kit shakes open, spilling its contents. He’s hit on the head by something that lodges in the maze of pipes and wiring at his feet. A flare pistol. Collins has lost her grip on the mechanical arm control, but the claw remains imbedded in the thing's mouth, locked closas.—As it thrashes, €hé minisub pitches.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: For God’s sake, let it go!

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: (banging the control) I can’t, it’s jammed! CLOSEUP - DEPTH GAUGE Almost to zero. Pierce’s eyes flick from the depth gauge to the flare gun -- then to the fuel gauge (the tanks are almost full) and right next door -- the FUEL DUMP switch. An idea is forming in Pierce’s mind. He reaches above his head, to the inside cover of the escape hatch marked:

dialogues.speaker: //LIFE RAFT//LIFE RAFT//LIFE RAFT//
dialogues.text: He pulls the arming pins. Reaching down, he picks up the flare pistol and tucks it into his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP - FORWARD VIEWPORT The minisub lurches hard and suddenly the viewing ports are wiped with foam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minisub breaks the surface. They’ve surfaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce pops the hatch, sucking in as much fresh air as his lungs will hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The life raft bursts from the hatch and begins to inflate. On the bow, the thing still struggles. It rocks the _minisub, trying to swamp it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce shouts down.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Abandon ship! Collins is trapped under the control panel. She’s trying to wrestle it off, but it won’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: I can’t move... Pierce doesn’t hesitate, he drops down by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing tips the minisub over hard, shipping water down the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce grabs the control panel and heaves. It just won’t move. The sub heels over the other way, water pours into the hatch, drenching them. Water rises up past Collins shoulders, splashing over her face. She gulps for air, getting only ocean. Pierce is really tired of all of this shit -- he grabs the goddamn panel and hauls on it. His fingers slip on the heavy, wet metal.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 98 23 23 23 24 24  99 Pierce looks around at the wreckage, searching quickly as another big wave comes down the hatch, totally immersing Collins head. He finds a piece of pipe, wedges one end under the panel and jumps on the other end. The panel lifts a little. Collins bursts clear, sputtering seawater from her lungs. Pierce helps her up to the hatch. Scrambling out the hatch, Collins trips and falters. Pierce puts both hands on her ass and shoves her out the hatch. Climbing out after her, he pauses to turn back to the instrument panel. With his foot, he kicks the FUEL DUMP switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuel is ejected from the minisub with a ROAR, two geysers of. fuel and seawater shooting up into the air. Collins clings to the conning tower. A growing pool of fuel forms around the sub. CLOSE ON THE THING - as it rips free of the remote arn, leaving a large clump of bloody tissue. aes Sw arge climp oF 2noedy Sisst Pierce pushes Collins into the now-inflated life raft and shoves it off with his foot. He remains on the sub.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Get clear of the sub!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t be crazy, come on! He steadies himself on the rocking sub, grabbing the flare pistol -- the fuel dump is nearly complete, fizzling out. He checks the load.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SIX
dialogues.text: 100 Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND YOU
dialogues.text: Pierce turns to look -- the thing heaves itself up the side of the_sub towards Pierce. It’s open mouth a torn, bloody mess. Pierce takes careful aim on the thing, pulling the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: Nothing happens. ‘The thi d, pulling itself closer. Pierce’s nostrils flare at the stench as he checks the flare pistol. This time he remembers to cock it. The thing HISSES.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, dickweed! Pierce FIRES. The flare shoots right down the thing’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: KA-BOOM
dialogues.text: The ocean explodes in a ball of flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins screams as the minisub is engulfed in a fireball. The fire spreads quickly across the water. Flames lick at the sides of the raft. Collins grabs a paddle, splashing them away. Then she is free. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: EXT DSRV-1 244
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON MINISUB - as the sea burns furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As tears run silently down her face. CLOSE ON THE WATER - as a faint ripple starts across, swimming towards the raft.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 246
dialogues.text: Collins grabs the paddle, ready.

dialogues.speaker: WOOOSH
dialogues.text: A black figure rockets to the surface. She screams. It’s Pierce. Gasping for breath, he tries to pull himself aboard, but he’s so goddamn tired he can barely move. Collins helps Pierce into the raft, the fuel tanks on the minisub EXPLODE. They turn and watch as the sub burns, slipping slowly beneath the sea. Then it’s gone. Pierce and Collins lay in the bottom of the raft, exhausted, not really believing they made it. After a long, long time, Collins sits up.

dialogues.speaker: COLLINS
dialogues.text: Now what do we do? Pierce sits up with a groan -- he is pretty badly burned in a couple of places. —s He scans the horizon -- nothing but water. Pierce just stares at Collins, her wet and matted hair, torn underclothes that aren’t hiding much.  102 os He smiles, then picks up one of the small plastic ‘ paddles in the bottom of the raft and hands it to \ Collins.

dialogues.speaker: PIERCE
dialogues.text: Row. She sighs as she dips the paddle into the water. Pierce picks up the other paddle and digs in as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raft is just a speck on a vast and beautiful ocean as we:
